Here's a complete interactive HTML page implementing the recurrent miscarriage decision-making algorithm based on the provided guideline: ```html Recurrent Miscarriage Management Tool

Recurrent Miscarriage Management

Brighton & Sussex University Hospitals - GP019

Key Principles: A protocol is a set of measurable, objective standards to determine a course of action. Professional judgement may be used in the application of a protocol.

Clinical Context

Patient History

Investigations

Clinical Guidance

Based on your inputs, guidance will appear here.

Initial Assessment

Please select the clinical context and complete the patient history questions to receive specific guidance.

Investigation Guidance

Antiphospholipid Syndrome Testing

Blood tests for Antiphospholipid antibodies should be arranged before discharge from EPU clinic, to be performed 6 weeks after the miscarriage.

Screening should include tests for lupus anticoagulant and anticardiolipin antibodies.

Cytogenetics

Karyotyping should be offered to women at the third consecutive miscarriage, and tissue should be sent for analysis.

Thrombophilia Screen

Full Thrombophilia screen is indicated in women with second trimester miscarriage only.

Treatment should be discussed and initiated with consultant discussion. Women with positive thrombophilia screen should be advised to use LMWH.

Follow-up

Follow-up will be arranged in the Recurrent Miscarriage Clinic.

Management Plan

Antiphospholipid Syndrome Management

If APLS is confirmed, consider aspirin and heparin therapy in subsequent pregnancies.

No Abnormality Detected

Women with no detected cause behind their miscarriage should be reassured and offered early contact with EPU.

Anti-D Administration should be referred to the current miscarriage guideline.

Advanced Maternal Age

For women aged 38 years or older with 2 consecutive miscarriages, offer karyotyping and consider referral to a specialist clinic.
